brief_description: Assess the immunogenicity and antigenicity of recombinant hemagglutinin proteins produced and purified by various methods
brief_title: Antigenic and immunogenic properties of recombinant hemagglutinin proteins when produced in various protein expression systems
condition_studied: Binding of anti-HA specific antibodies, elicited by vaccination or viral infection, to various recombinant forms of the HA from A/Brisbane/59/07 and B/Florida/04/06
description: Assess the immunogenicity and antigenicity of recombinant hemagglutinin proteins produced and purified by various methods
endpoints: Various timepoints following immunization and or infection
hypothesis: Recombinant HA proteins that have been produced under conditions that preserve their biological activity and tertiary structure offer optimal detection of HA-specific responses in common immune assays.
intervention_agent: Recombinant Hemagglutinin proteins from  A/Brisbane/59/07 and B/Florida/04/06.  Viruses:  A/Brisbane/59/07 and B/Florida/04/06
objectives: Determine the degree of antibody cross-reactivity elicited by vaccination with drifted variant H5 hemagglutinins. Determine the neutralization activity of the antibodies elicited by vaccination. Determine the extent of protection elicited by vacciantion.
official_title: Antigenic and immunogenic properties of recombinant hemagglutinin proteins from H1N1 A/Brisbane/59/07 and B/Florida/04/06 when produced in various protein expression systems

pubmed.title: Antigenic and immunogenic properties of recombinant hemagglutinin proteins from H1N1 A/Brisbane/59/07 and B/Florida/04/06 when produced in various protein expression systems.

program.program_name: NIAID Centers of Excellence for Influenza Research and Surveillance (CEIRS)
program.contract_name: New York Influenza Center of Excellence
